suppress.notes: false positive, CVE concerns the interactive installer in PostgreSQL which we dont use

false positive, CVE concerns the maxRandom function of a smart contract implementation which generates a random value with publicly readable variables because the _seed value can be retrieved. Falls into the category of use of Cryptographically Weak Pseudo-Random Number Generator (PRNG). Given we aren't in a secure or cryptographic context I'm suppressing as a false positive.
